New Records: India registered a record-shattering 168-run victory over New Zealand in the third T20I at Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad.
Key Match Events: Shubman Gill scored his maiden century and became the 5th Indian to score centuries across formats.
Hardik Pandya produced an all-round show, taking 4 for 16 in 4 overs, and scoring 30 runs with the bat.
New Zealand lost four wickets in the first three overs, reducing them to 7 for 4 in 2.4 overs.
India posted 234 for 4 in their 20 overs, with Shubman Gill scoring 126 off 63 balls, the highest individual T20I score by an Indian.
